borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">No development shall commence, including any works of demolition, until a Construction Environmental Management&nbsp; Plan (CEMP) and a Site Waste Management Plan (SWMP) have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. These Plans shall incorporate details of:</span></p><p style="margin-left:40px; text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">a) construction traffic management;</span></p><p style="margin-left:40px; text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">b) the parking of vehicles of site operatives and visitors;</span></p><p style="margin-left:40px; text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">c) loading and unloading of plant and materials;</span></p><p style="margin-left:40px; text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">d) storage of plant and materials used in constructing the development;</span></p><p style="margin-left:40px; text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">e) the erection and maintenance of security hoarding(s) including decorative displays and facilities for public viewing, where appropriate;</span></p><p style="margin-left:40px; text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">f) wheel washing facilities;</span></p><p style="margin-left:40px; text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">g) measures to control the emission of dust, dirt and emissions to air during construction; such measures to accord with the guidance provided in the document “The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition”, Mayor of London, July 2014; including but not confined to, non- road mobile machinery (NRMM) requirements;</span></p><p style="margin-left:40px; text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">h) noise and vibration control;</span></p><p style="margin-left:40px; text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">i) a scheme for recycling/disposing of waste resulting from demolition and construction works;</span></p><p style="margin-left:40px; text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">j) the use of efficient construction materials;</span></p><p style="margin-left:40px; text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">k) methods to minimise waste, to encourage re-use, recovery and recycling, and sourcing of materials; and </span></p><p style="margin-left:40px; text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">l) a nominated Developer/Resident Liaison Representative with an address and contact telephone number to be circulated to those residents consulted on the application by the developer’s representatives. This person will act as first point of contact for residents who have any problems or questions related to the ongoing development. </span></p><p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">Demolition and construction work and associated activities, other than internal works inaudible outside the site boundary, are only to be carried out between the hours of 08:00 and 18:00 Monday to Friday and 08:00 and 13:00 Saturday, with no work on Sundays or public holidays without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority. Any works which are associated with the generation of ground borne vibration are only to be carried out between the hours of 08:00 and 18:00 Monday to Friday. </span></p><p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt">Demolition and construction work and associated activities are to be carried out in accordance with the recommendations contained within British Standard 5228:2009, “Code of practice for noise and vibration control on construction and open sites”, Parts 1 and 2. Once approved the Plans shall be adhered to throughout the construction period for the development.</span></p>
The development shall be constructed in accordance with the external materials shown on DRAWING NO. XXX and to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.

The development hereby approved shall only be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:

- DRAWING XXX REV XX DATED XX
- USE [SHIFT]+[ENTER] FOR REGULAR LINE SPACING
- USE [ENTER] FOR LARGER LINE SPACING

No other drawings or documents apply.
The development hereby permitted shall be commenced before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
description: Addition of 2x new storage containers and 1x 'Cafe' container unit with serving hatches within boundary of the artificial grass pitches (AGPs) and modification of the pitch fences within the existing AGP boundaries. Additional attenuation pond for AGP drainage.
